title: static link of dynamic object with fortran libs on Cray
body:
I've been testing some static builds on Edison and Cori and came across this error:
`/usr/bin/ld: attempted static link of dynamic object /opt/gcc/6.1.0/snos/lib/../lib64/libgfortran.so`
The error message comes from building abinit. 

On Cray machines, we set CRAYPE_LINK_TYPE=dynamic. This is to standardize Cray's environment. After some investigating, I found the culprit for this error:
` -Wl,-rpath=/opt/cray/gcc-libs`
Same happens with intel:
`-Wl,-rpath=/opt/intel/composer_xe_2015/compiler/lib/intel64`

These get placed in Cray's compiler wrapper whenever the link type is set to dynamic.

A solution off the top of my head is changing CRAYPE_LINK_TYPE=static for static variants, but not sure if this is an elegant solution since this means each package will have a `setup_environment` method to manipulate the link type environment variable. Wondering if anyone has any insight on this.
